text: Your Friday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to ‘The Daily’A self-perpetuating cycle of wildfires.
Listen to ‘The Argument’An Opinion round table on how to win the Latino vote.

Officials in Oregon are preparing for a “mass fatality incident,” as fires have consumed more than a million acres in the state.Oregon’s fires are unlike anything the state has ever seen, the governor said. And fires are growing in California and Washington. Here’s the latest.
Authorities sought to dispel false rumors that left-wing activists were out setting fires and looting homes. But some vowed to stay to protect property.
Wildfire smoke is dangerous. Here’s how to protect yourself.
Maps showing the major fires that are burning in the western states.
View photographs from California, Oregon and Washington, where hundreds of thousands were under evacuation orders.

China Uses the Promise of a Coronavirus Vaccine as a Diplomatic CarrotChina is launching a charm offensive aimed at repairing ties and bringing friends closer in regions deemed vital to its interests. Here’s the latest.

A Lifeline to the Jobless Has Problems With Fraud, and With MathAn emergency federal program faces growing issues with spurious claims, and the flood of applicants may have led to overcounting the unemployed.
With Over 88,000 Cases, Campuses Are the New Virus Hot SpotsLike meatpacking plants and nursing homes early in the pandemic, campuses across the country are experiencing outbreaks.

Hostilities on Hold for a Day, Trump and Biden Head to ShanksvilleJoe Biden and President Trump were visiting Pennsylvania separately, honoring the victims of the hijacked plane that crashed after passengers fought back.
Mercedes Arias, whose father, Joseph Amatuccio worked in the South Tower in the World Trade Center, visits his name at the 9/11 Memorial in Manhattan on Friday. Todd Heisler/The New York Times
Veterans Fortify the Ranks of Militias Aligned With Trump’s ViewsThe vast majority of veterans do not join militias, but some fast-growing militias have many veterans among their ranks.
A top aide in the review of the Russia investigation unexpectedly resigned from the Justice Department.

Bahrain Will Normalize Relations With Israel, in Deal Brokered by TrumpThe island kingdom in the Persian Gulf becomes the second Arab nation in a month to more openly embrace Israel, dismissing Palestinian objections.
A tax protest by the Palestinian government has caused suffering for those living in the West Bank.

An artist’s concept of Planet Nine, a yet-unobserved object thought to orbit 20 billion miles from the sun. Some astronomers have suggested that it may be a black hole the size of a Ping-Pong ball.  R. Hurt/Caltech/IPAC, via Reuters
Timothy EganI’ve Never Seen the American West in Such Deep DistressWe’re choking on smoke and staring out at Martian-red skies in a world becoming uninhabitable.

Your Friday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to ‘The Daily’A self-perpetuating cycle of wildfires.
Listen to ‘The Argument’An Opinion round table on how to win the Latino vote.

A 36-mile-wide line of flames edged into the towns around Portland, Ore., and firefighters struggled to contain blazes across the Pacific Northwest.Fires in California, Oregon and Washington have torn through towns, reducing some neighborhoods to ash. Hundreds, if not thousands, of homes have been lost.
A man was charged with starting part of one of this year’s most destructive fires in Oregon. Here’s the latest.
Authorities sought to dispel false rumors that left-wing activists were out setting fires and looting homes. But some vowed to stay to protect property.
View photographs from the record-setting fire season that has hundreds of thousands under evacuation orders.
See tracking maps showing the major fires that are burning in the Western states.
Smoke spreads misery, including health problems, far beyond fire zones. We have key facts and tips.

China Uses the Promise of a Coronavirus Vaccine as a Diplomatic CarrotChina is launching a charm offensive aimed at repairing ties and bringing friends closer in regions deemed vital to its interests. Here’s the latest.

A Lifeline to the Jobless Has Problems With Fraud, and With MathAn emergency federal program faces growing issues with spurious claims, and the flood of applicants may have led to overcounting the unemployed.
With Over 88,000 Cases, Campuses Are the New Virus Hot SpotsLike meatpacking plants and nursing homes early in the pandemic, campuses across the country are experiencing outbreaks.

Hostilities on Hold, Trump and Biden Pay Respects to Sept. 11 VictimsJoe Biden traveled to ground zero and then to Shanksville, Pa., where he and the president separately commemorated the 19th anniversary of the attacks.
Mercedes Arias, whose father, Joseph Amatuccio worked in the South Tower in the World Trade Center, visits his name at the 9/11 Memorial in Manhattan on Friday. Todd Heisler/The New York Times
Ex-Felons in Florida Must Pay Fines Before Voting, Appeals Court RulesThe decision was a reversal two years after Florida’s voters decided to end the disenfranchisement of most felons.
Veterans Fortify the Ranks of Militias Aligned With Trump’s ViewsThe vast majority of veterans do not join militias, but some fast-growing militias have many veterans among their ranks.
A top aide in the review of the Russia investigation unexpectedly resigned from the Justice Department.

Bahrain Will Normalize Relations With Israel, in Deal Brokered by TrumpThe island kingdom in the Persian Gulf becomes the second Arab nation in a month to more openly embrace Israel, dismissing Palestinian objections.
Bahrain Says It’s Time to Embrace Israel. The Gulf Hears a Saudi Voice.Bahrain’s closeness to Saudi rulers makes it unthinkable that the change in diplomatic ties happened without approval.

Listen to ‘The Argument’An Opinion round table on how to win the Latino vote.

A 36-mile-wide line of flames edged into the towns around Portland, Ore., and firefighters struggled to contain blazes across the Pacific Northwest.Fires in California, Oregon and Washington have torn through towns, reducing some neighborhoods to ash. Hundreds, if not thousands, of homes have been lost.
A man was charged with arson for his role in one of this year’s most destructive fires in Oregon. Here’s the latest.
Authorities sought to dispel false rumors that left-wing activists were out setting fires and looting homes. But some vowed to stay to protect property.
View photographs from the record-setting fire season that has hundreds of thousands under evacuation orders.
See tracking maps showing the major fires that are burning in the Western states.
Wildfire smoke is dangerous. Here’s how to protect yourself.

Anthony Fauci Warns Return to Normalcy Could Be a Year AwayThe nation’s top infectious diseases expert cautioned the virus could disrupt life in the U.S. “maybe even towards the end of 2021.” Here’s the latest.

A Lifeline to the Jobless Has Problems With Fraud, and With MathAn emergency federal program faces growing issues with spurious claims, and the flood of applicants may have led to overcounting the unemployed.
With Over 88,000 Cases, Campuses Are the New Virus Hot SpotsLike meatpacking plants and nursing homes early in the pandemic, campuses across the country are experiencing outbreaks.

Hostilities on Hold, Trump and Biden Pay Respects to Sept. 11 VictimsJoe Biden traveled to ground zero and then to Shanksville, Pa., where he and the president separately commemorated the 19th anniversary of the attacks.
Mercedes Arias, whose father, Joseph Amatuccio worked in the South Tower in the World Trade Center, visits his name at the 9/11 Memorial in Manhattan on Friday. Todd Heisler/The New York Times
Ex-Felons in Florida Must Pay Fines Before Voting, Appeals Court RulesThe decision was a reversal two years after Florida’s voters decided to end the disenfranchisement of most felons.
Veterans Fortify the Ranks of Militias Aligned With Trump’s ViewsThe vast majority of veterans do not join militias, but some fast-growing militias have many veterans among their ranks.
A top aide in the review of the Russia investigation unexpectedly resigned from the Justice Department.

Bahrain Will Normalize Relations With Israel, in Deal Brokered by TrumpThe island kingdom in the Persian Gulf becomes the second Arab nation in a month to more openly embrace Israel, dismissing Palestinian objections.
Bahrain Says It’s Time to Embrace Israel. The Gulf Hears a Saudi Voice.Bahrain’s closeness to Saudi rulers makes it unthinkable that the change in diplomatic ties happened without approval.

An artist’s concept of Planet Nine, a yet-unobserved object thought to orbit 20 billion miles from the sun. Some astronomers have suggested that it may be a black hole the size of a Ping-Pong ball.  R. Hurt/Caltech/IPAC, via Reuters
